conclusion: Analyze the geometry of the semi-circular glass brick and conditions for total internal reflection.

The image shows a semi-circular glass brick with center O and radius R, placed on a horizontal surface. Light is incident from a vertical line at point P and is totally reflected inside the glass brick. The incident angle at point P is 60°.
The light is incident at point P with an angle of 60°.
Total internal reflection occurs when the angle of incidence exceeds the critical angle. Here, the angle of incidence is greater than 60°, so the light is totally reflected.
The light exits parallel to the incident light, indicating it follows the tangent to the circular surface at the exit point.
The radius of the glass brick is R, and the distance from O to P is OP.
By the properties of a semi-circle, the angle ∠OPB is 90°.
In triangle OPB, since ∠OPB = 90°, OP is perpendicular to PB.
Using the sine rule in triangle OPB, we have: OP/sin 60° = R/sin 30° = R/0.5.
Solving for OP: OP = R × (sin 60°/0.5) = R × (√3/2)/0.5 = R × √3.
Therefore, the distance OP is R × √3.
